snippet: The Southern Company hopes the Nuclear Regulatory Commission will greenlight a $14 billion construction project at an existing nuclear plant in Waynesboro, Ga.
abstract: The Southern Company hopes the Nuclear Regulatory Commission will greenlight a $14 billion construction project at an existing nuclear plant in Waynesboro, Ga.
lead_paragraph: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission meets at noon to decide whether to grant a construction and operating license for two new reactors at Plant Vogtle in Georgia. If issued, it would be the first license granted for a new reactor in the United States in more than three decades. A live Webcast of the meeting will be available here.
